M001-UNNEWED-VARIABLE.description: Local variables should be NEWed before use to avoid unintended side effects

M002-UNCLOSED-STRING.description: String must be properly closed with matching quotes

M003-LOWERCASE-COMMAND.description: MUMPS commands should be uppercase for consistency

M004-UNUSED-LABEL.message: Label '{label}' is defined but never called
M004-UNUSED-LABEL.description: Unused labels may indicate dead code

M005-UNREACHABLE-CODE.description: Commands after QUIT or HALT on the same line will never execute

M006-MISSING-QUIT.description: Labels should end with QUIT to prevent fall-through

M007-MISMATCHED-PARENS.description: Opening and closing parentheses must match

M008-INVALID-VARIABLE.description: Variable names must start with letter or %

M009-GOTO-CONSIDERED-HARMFUL.message: Consider using DO instead of GOTO
M009-GOTO-CONSIDERED-HARMFUL.description: GOTO can make code harder to follow; DO is preferred

M010-MISSING-POSTCOND.message: Consider using postconditional instead of IF

M012-MAGIC-NUMBER.message: Magic number '{number}' - consider using named constant

M013-LONG-LINE.message: Line exceeds 255 characters ({length} chars) - MUMPS standard limit
M013-LONG-LINE.description: MUMPS standard specifies maximum line length of 255 characters for portability

M015-NAKED-REFERENCE.description: Naked references can lead to bugs; use explicit references

M016-LOCK-WITHOUT-TIMEOUT.message: LOCK without timeout may cause deadlock
M016-LOCK-WITHOUT-TIMEOUT.description: Always specify timeout for LOCK commands

M018-HARDCODED-PATH.description: Use configuration or variables for file paths

M020-SPACE-AFTER-COMMA.description: MUMPS syntax does not allow spaces after commas in argument lists

M021-LABEL-AT-COLUMN1.message: Label must start at column 1 (no leading spaces)
M021-LABEL-AT-COLUMN1.description: Routine labels must be placed in the first column without indentation

M022-COMMAND-INDENTATION.message: Executable lines should be indented under their label
M022-COMMAND-INDENTATION.description: Commands associated with a label should start with at least one leading space for better readability

M023-TRAILING-COMMA.message: Trailing comma at end of command
M023-TRAILING-COMMA.description: Commands cannot end with a comma; remove the comma or add the missing argument

M024-EMPTY-ARGUMENT.message: Empty argument between commas in command
M024-EMPTY-ARGUMENT.description: Command arguments cannot be empty (e.g., WRITE "a",,! is invalid). Function parameters may have empty arguments (e.g., FUNC(1,,3) is valid).

M025-MISSING-COMMAND-SPACE.description: Multiple commands on a line must be separated by spaces

M026-UNKNOWN-COMMAND.description: Command is neither a full keyword nor a valid abbreviation

M027-AMBIGUOUS-COMMAND.description: Use a longer command name or the full keyword to avoid ambiguity

M028-INVALID-LABEL.description: Labels must be 1â€“16 alphanumeric characters starting with a letter or %
